bug.author: modesitt-sesco
bug.summary: [Bug] dgl.to_homo fails on given example in pytorch 1.3.1
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Simply run the to_homo example <denchmark-code>import dgl
follows_g = dgl.graph([(0, 1), (1, 2)], 'user', 'follows') devs_g = dgl.bipartite([(0, 0), (1, 1)], 'developer', 'develops', 'game') hetero_g = dgl.hetero_from_relations([follows_g, devs_g]) homo_g = dgl.to_homo(hetero_g) </denchmark-code>
and it fails with <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/convert.py", line 598, in to_homo retg = graph((F.cat(srcs, 0), F.cat(dsts, 0)), card=total_num_nodes) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/convert.py", line 111, in graph return create_from_edges(u, v, ntype, etype, ntype, urange, vrange) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/convert.py", line 646, in create_from_edges u = utils.toindex(u) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/utils.py", line 242, in toindex return data if isinstance(data, Index) else Index(data) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/utils.py", line 15, in __init__ self._initialize_data(data) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/utils.py", line 22, in _initialize_data self._dispatch(data) File "/Users/dmodesitt/Dev/playground/virt/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/utils.py", line 47, in _dispatch raise DGLError('Index data must be an int64 vector, but got: %s' % str(data)) dgl._ffi.base.DGLError: Index data must be an int64 vector, but got: tensor([0., 1., 3., 4.]) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
This is not expected to crash it is a given <denchmark-link:https://docs.dgl.ai/generated/dgl.to_homo.html#dgl.to_homo>example</denchmark-link>

DGL Version (e.g., 1.0): dgl==0.4.1 Backend Library & Version (e.g., PyTorch 0.4.1, MXNet/Gluon 1.3): pytorch==1.3.1 OS (e.g., Linux): macos How you installed DGL (conda, pip, source): pip Python version: 3.7.4

comments.comment: Verified the report. This seems to be related to the latest PyTorch version as our CI tests with PyTorch 1.1 can be successfully passed.
This should now be fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/dgl/pull/1019>#1019</denchmark-link> . You can install from source to get the latest version.
